page.title: 07FARMING, DOWNS EDINGTON (2)
page.content: West Down Farm is part of a typical chalk and vale farm.There are 46 acres of rough grazing east of Long Hollow; its contours too steep to plough; 340 acres arable,Schedule 1; 60 acres Schedule 3. Rotation of 60 acre blocks; 1st year winter wheat,2nd year winter barley (half this is now winter oil seed rape),3rd year winter wheat, 4th year winter oats,5th year winter wheat,6th year spring barley.This year 30 acres durum wheat, re-drilled when frost killed,was still a failure because of cold wet summer,which caused it to sprout and be unsaleable. 30 acres of field beans yielded 3/4 to 1 tonne an acre.Yields of corn fell from 70 cwt an acre in 1975 to 55 cwt in 1985.It was dried,with difficulty,in ventilated storage bins at Ballards Farm (Edington),some stored in six West Down Farm silos.
